articles.headline: London Bombers Sped to Glasgow, Authorities Say
articles.snippet: A week after the intended bombings, evidence is emerging that two doctors were the main operatives, if not leaders, of a network of other medical professionals.
articles.abstract: A week after the intended bombings, evidence is emerging that two doctors were the main operatives, if not leaders, of a network of other medical professionals.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON, Scotland, July 5 — British investigators have concluded that the two men who carried out an attack at Glasgow’s international airport last Saturday had sped there after a failed attempt to bomb a nightclub in central London, a British security official said Thursday.
articles.byline: By Serge F. Kovaleski and Alan Cowell

articles.headline: Trump Deal Fails, and Shares Fall Again
articles.snippet: Donald J. Trump, the man who wrote “The Art of the Deal,” failed to make a deal this week, and his casino company’s shareholders are suffering. Again.
articles.abstract: Donald J. Trump, the man who wrote “The Art of the Deal,” failed to make a deal this week, and his casino company’s shareholders are suffering. Again.
articles.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump, the man who wrote “The Art of the Deal,” failed to make a deal this week, and his casino company’s shareholders are suffering. Again.

articles.headline: Japanese Retailer Makes Unsolicited Bid for Barneys
articles.snippet: Another shopper has rung up Barneys New York, the high-end fashion emporium that is being sold to the investment arm of the Dubai government for $825 million.
articles.abstract: Another shopper has rung up Barneys New York, the high-end fashion emporium that is being sold to the investment arm of the Dubai government for $825 million.
articles.lead_paragraph: Another shopper has rung up Barneys New York, the high-end fashion emporium that is being sold to the investment arm of the Dubai government for $825 million.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Microsoft to Spend $1.15 Billion for Xbox Repairs
articles.snippet: Microsoft on Thursday cited “an unacceptable number of repairs” to its Xbox 360 for the charge, and announced an extended warranty for the video game console.
articles.abstract: Microsoft on Thursday cited “an unacceptable number of repairs” to its Xbox 360 for the charge, and announced an extended warranty for the video game console.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES, July 5 — In what may be one of the costliest consumer warranty repairs in history, Microsoft announced on Thursday that it would spend up to $1.15 billion to repair failing Xbox 360 game machine consoles.

articles.headline: After Losses, UBS Ousts Its Chief
articles.snippet: In a surprise move, the Swiss bank UBS said that its chief executive, Peter A. Wuffli, would be succeeded by his deputy, Marcel Rohner, effective immediately.
articles.abstract: In a surprise move, the Swiss bank UBS said that its chief executive, Peter A. Wuffli, would be succeeded by his deputy, Marcel Rohner, effective immediately.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a surprise move, the Swiss bank UBS said late yesterday that its chief executive, Peter A. Wuffli, would be succeeded by his deputy, Marcel Rohner, effective immediately.

articles.headline: Second Suitor Makes a Bid for Barneys
articles.snippet: The Fast Retailing Company, the Japanese retailer that owns the Uniqlo line of stores, made an unsolicited $900 million bid for Barneys New York.
articles.abstract: The Fast Retailing Company, the Japanese retailer that owns the Uniqlo line of stores, made an unsolicited $900 million bid for Barneys New York.
articles.lead_paragraph: Another shopper has rung up Barneys New York, the high-end fashion emporium that Jones Apparel has agreed to sell to the investment arm of the Dubai government for $825 million.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: G.I.’s Forge Sunni Tie in Bid to Squeeze Militants
articles.snippet: In Baquba, Iraq, local Sunni residents, including former insurgents, have emerged as a linchpin of the American strategy.
articles.abstract: In Baquba, Iraq, local Sunni residents, including former insurgents, have emerged as a linchpin of the American strategy.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAQUBA, Iraq, June 30 — Capt. Ben Richards had been battling insurgents from Al Qaeda in Mesopotamia for three weeks when he received an unexpected visitor.

articles.headline: A Flight Plan for the Long Haul
articles.snippet: The chairman of Emirates airline —Sheik Ahmed bin Saeed al-Maktoum of the ruling family of Dubai — has grand ambitions and a bankroll to match.
articles.abstract: The chairman of Emirates airline —Sheik Ahmed bin Saeed al-Maktoum of the ruling family of Dubai — has grand ambitions and a bankroll to match.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS —The chairman of Emirates airline —Sheik Ahmed bin Saeed al-Maktoum of the ruling family of Dubai — has grand ambitions and a bankroll to match.

articles.headline: 2008 Candidates Vow to Overhaul U.S. Health Care
articles.snippet: The different approaches reflect longstanding divisions on the role of government versus the private market.
articles.abstract: The different approaches reflect longstanding divisions on the role of government versus the private market.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 5 — There is no better measure of the power of the health care issue than this: Sixteen months before Election Day, presidential candidates in both parties are promising to overhaul the system and cover more — if not all — of the 44.8 million people without insurance.

articles.headline: Far From Home, Mexicans Sing Age-Old Ballads of a New Life
articles.snippet: Mexican folk ballads known as corridos have moved north with immigrants and adopted new themes.
articles.abstract: Mexican folk ballads known as corridos have moved north with immigrants and adopted new themes.
articles.lead_paragraph: NAMPA, Idaho — Watching television coverage of immigration marches, Jose F. Garcia got mad. He got frustrated. He got his button accordion.
